title: Diploma in VMware vSphere 6.0
headline: Learn about the virtualization, configuration, and monitoring of VMware vSphere 6.0 from this free online IT course.
description: Stand out in your IT admin career with the help of this free course on VMware vSphere 6.0! This course analyzes the functions of hypervisors in a virtual machine and shows you how to integrate the ESXi Active Directory. Explore ways to export virtual machines to open virtualization format (OVF) and the functions of the distributed resource scheduler (DRS) cluster. Start this course today and upgrade your senior solutions engineering skills.
courseDescription:
Having a hard time understanding the virtualization processes in VMware vSphere 6.0? Are you an IT administrator wanting to upskill yourself or prepare for the certification exam? This free online course provides an easy-to-understand guide to the virtualization processes in VMware 6.0. It also highlights the various updates made on previous versions of VMware. You will learn about the software-defined data centre (SDDC) along with how it simplifies data management in VMware 6.0. Explore the functions of type 1 and type 2 hypervisors (ESXi hosts) and the minimum physical hardware requirements for their installation. You will also evaluate different versions of VMware ESXi 6.0. This course analyzes the functions of the VMware horizon flex in providing flexibility while maintaining security and compliance. It illustrates VMware Workstation Pro 12 as a hosted hypervisor that runs on x64 versions of Windows and Linux. You will also study the functionality of VMware Fusion 8.

Ever wondered how the DCUI (direct console user interface) is used to locally configure ESXi 6.0 and how pre-conversion is carried out in the configuration of VMware vCenter Converter 6.0? This course succinctly describes the local configuration of ESXi 6.0 using DCUI. Next, analyze the differences between virtual machines (VM) and physical hardware as well as how to set up ESXi account security configuration. This course explains the pre-conversion process in the configuration of VMware vCenter Converter as well as how to automatically start-up, shut down along with the ways to enable VM startup and shut down the Virtual Machine in VMware 6.0. Get to contrast VM and physical hardware as well as the different types of storage reports that can be collected. You will then examine how these storage reports can be exported using the .csv format.

Finally, this course exposes you to the functions of snapshots in virtual machines. Update your knowledge of the installation process of the ESXi standalone patch. By taking this course, you learn about the new updates made to the vSphere Replication (VR) version 6.0. You will also be able to explain how the ESXi upgrade is carried out using Update Manager 6.0 and how to use the Web Client to upgrade VMware Tools. Upon the completion of this course, you will be able to identify the features of VMware Site Recovery Manager (SRM). Learn about the processes involved in the configuration of HA (high-availability) clusters as well as the virtualization of Microsoft clusters in VMware 6.0. This course also covers the architecture of the Site Recovery Manager in VMware 6.0. It is targeted at computer engineering students, IT enthusiasts and senior solutions engineering professionals interested in VMware configuration. Begin this course today and upgrade your VMware vSphere 6.0 expertise.
